1491162282369650688.text: I wish the more than 200 athletes on @TeamUSA the best – and I pray they stay safe while they are away from home. 🇺🇸 🇺🇸 🇺🇸

1491162181257564160.text: The next time a host country is chosen, it is important that the IOC pick any of the dozens of democracies around the world.

1491162129692770304.text:
The Olympic Committee could have required China to respect the basic liberties athletes enjoy in the United States and other Western countries.
 
But they didn’t.

1491162071148695552.text: This all could have been avoided. We didn’t have to host a unifying event like the Olympics in a country that thinks the book 1984 is an instruction manual.

1491162017591623681.text: The U.S. Olympic & Paralympic Committee has gone as far as to tell American athletes to “assume that every device and every communication, transaction, and online activity will be monitored”, and many other nations have issued similar warnings.

1491161751186194432.text: They had years to plan for these Olympics. But they still chose not to adopt any rules to protect the human rights of Olympians while they are in China. Instead, competitors are required to follow local laws limiting free expression, privacy, and other basic freedoms.

1491161565063970816.text: We shouldn’t pretend that everything is fine in China just because the IOC chose them to host the Olympics.

1491161396079624196.text: If this is how China treats its own people, I think it’s fair to ask: What kind of risks are our athletes facing as they participate in the Olympic Games?

1491161326202535942.text: Her existence was scrubbed from the internet. She disappeared from the public eye for months, and the only appearances she has been allowed to make since have been scripted and supervised by the CCP.

1491161181590933504.text: This wasn’t just any politician: He was the face of China’s successful effort to land the 2022 Olympics. Speaking out about someone like this is dangerous in a country like China. Peng Shuai knew that – but I don’t think she expected what came next.

1491161083415269376.text: Last November, one of the most famous athletes in China, tennis star Peng Shuai, posted on social media that a high-ranking politician in the Chinese Communist Party had sexually assaulted her.

1491160993753604096.text: The very same government that’s hosting the Olympics this week is putting innocent people in labor camps and subjecting them to forced sterilization, forced labor, and physical and psychological torture. This is genocide.

1491160957376434177.text: But make no mistake: Beijing 2022 is no ordinary Olympics.

1491160898203164672.text: The American athletes competing in the Olympics this year have earned their spots on Team USA. And I wish them the best as they compete against other athletes from around the world.

1491160661149503488.text:

1481020393007820803.text:
I urge my colleagues to think beyond the passions of the moment and do what’s best for our country in the long term.
 
Leave the filibuster in place. Democrats may want to use it again as soon as next year.

1481020391783079938.text:
Bipartisanship would become a relic of the past.
 
I know Democrats don’t want that to happen. I don’t want it to happen, either.

1481020390549999619.text:
The truth is that some of my Democratic colleagues want to remake the American system only in their own image, not considering the views of about half of our citizens.

To do that, they have to take an ax to the filibuster.

1481020389283274752.text: When Republicans were in the majority, we said we wouldn’t abolish the legislative filibuster, and we kept our word.

1481020388066963458.text:
This is not a debate about some arcane Senate rule.
 
This is about protecting the rights of the minority in our democracy.
 
This is about providing stability and certainty to our people.

1481020386800197638.text: Democrats were perfectly happy to use the filibuster literally hundreds of times during the four years of the Trump presidency, when the Majority Leader was the Minority Leader and Republicans had even larger majorities in Congress.

1481020385621598208.text: But because the rules don’t allow them to pass their federal takeover of elections or any of their other reckless policies in a 50-50 Senate, many of my Dem colleagues are flip-flopping to oppose the filibuster.

1481020384422113281.text: The first part of that simply isn’t true. The right to vote is not under assault.

1481020383205761024.text: Their argument is that lawmakers in red states are trying to make it harder for people to vote, and so it’s necessary for Washington Democrats to take over election administration in all 50 states.

1481020381817417729.text: The American people voted for bipartisanship and compromise in the United States Congress, not a blanket mandate for progressives to reorganize American life as they see fit.

1481020380525563912.text:
President Biden wants to pass a New Deal. In fact, the reckless spending the president is pushing for dwarfs the New Deal.

Back then the New Deal passed the on the back of Dem supermajorities, but today we have a 50-50 Senate and the Dem majority is razor thin.

1481017134746583052.text:

1423358359026163721.text: During this comment seeking period, I encourage all Nebraskans to submit comments to the federal register on how these regulations affect our families, communities, and businesses. https://t.co/vQ8K6JIhdH

1423358357835034624.text:
Pres. Obama’s 2015 WOTUS rule represented a significant federal overreach over our water resources which burdened Nebraskans with higher costs and regulations.

Since its repeal under the Trump admin, Nebraskans have been put back in charge of our state’s precious resources.

1423336594111610890.text: And Congress would embrace a decision by the Biden administration to remain committed to nuclear modernization.

1423336592589131779.text: I believe Congress will continue to support modernizing our nuclear enterprise, in order to ensure that we have a capable and effective deterrent, supported by a modern infrastructure.

1423336591234408450.text: The decisions we make today will define the deterrent we field in the next fifteen years. We expect this force to be the bedrock of our national security for at least the next four decades.

1423336589846106114.text: Failing to modernize, and allowing our forces to age until they become obsolete, only makes future arms control agreements less likely—not more.

1423336588520693761.text:
Some of my colleagues argue that canceling U.S. modernization programs could inspire Russia and China to do the same and create an opening for arms control negotiations.
 
However, looking at the behavior of China and Russia over the past 25 years, this is clearly not the case.

1423336587107225605.text: It’s clear that nuclear deterrence will continue to be vital to our security for the foreseeable future. The current modernization program of record is the most prudent and cost-effective approach to ensuring that our nation continues to field a capable nuclear deterrent.

1423336585580457986.text: In anticipation of the Nuclear Posture Review, we’ve seen renewed debate on many modernization programs. However, I remain confident that the Biden administration will continue on the modernization path set by the Obama administration and followed by the Trump administration.

1423336583978180614.text: We continue to read reports of China building up its nuclear arsenal. This is not the time to let our deterrent age out.

1423336582447308801.text: The Senate #FY22NDAA passed out of committee with a solid bipartisan vote fully supporting our nuclear forces at a time when global threats are rising.

1423336580887031811.text: As the ranking member on the Strategic Forces subcommittee, it was great to virtually join the Annual Deterrence Summit today to discuss #FY22NDAA and the importance of modernizing our nuclear forces.

Our bill requires the @FCC to create rules to allow domestic violence survivors to separate their mobile phone line from a group plan without penalties and take other steps to protect them from their abusers.
 
Read more on the bill in my weekly column: https://t.co/3Uh3tSPsbU

1361852874372902912.text: Senator @BrianSchatz and I have introduced the bipartisan Safe Connections Act to help survivors separate from their abusers.

1361852873525575683.text: When you’re stuck in the same house as your abusive partner, technology can be your only lifeline to the outside world. Many of these victims share a cell phone plan with their abusers, who see a shared phone bill, where they can often see every call and text.

1361852872372158465.text: According to the @Ne_Coalition, there has been an increase in victims seeking help during COVID. In the 12-month period ending on 9/30/20, the programs they assist across Nebraska received 40,000 calls to their hotline.

In this latest COVID relief package, key priorities I have been working on to benefit Nebraska passed:

1341403401129766915.text:
Last night, Congress passed an additional relief package which will help Nebraska schools, farmers, hospitals, and small businesses. It will also support vaccine distribution. 
 
American people needed this relief. While it took too long, I'm glad we could get it done.

1341145403295723520.text: Whether it’s caring for elderly parents or taking care of sick children working Americans will benefit from the flexibility my program offers.

1341145402268147715.text: This extension means businesses will be able to take advantage of this program and offer paid family leave to their employees who are caring for their families while juggling workplace responsibilities.

1341145401211183107.text: I am very happy to report that the COVID relief bill also includes a five-year extension of my paid family leave tax credit program, the first EVER U.S. nationwide PFL policy.

1341145400099672064.text: It includes the bipartisan REEF Act, which I was proud to cosponsor, that will help ensure during this pandemic that railroaders receive the full unemployment and sickness benefits they deserve.

1341145398988206080.text: It provides $15 million to speed implementation of the medical surge capacity pilot I included in #FY21NDAA, enhancing civ/mil partnerships to improve federal pandemic response. This will offer universities like @UNMC the chance to participate.

1341145397922848776.text: The package includes a 15% increase in SNAP benefits to help struggling families who are food insecure during this pandemic. This has been a priority of mine, and I am glad to see it was included.

1341145396773576705.text: The legislation includes my AIR Act, which will provide Nebraska airports with more certainty during this pandemic and ensure they plan for future infrastructure projects.

1341145395750178818.text: I am really pleased this bill includes essential priorities I have been working on that will benefit Nebraskans, including:

1341145394726760451.text: The text of the COVID-19 relief package has been released. This legislation will bring much-needed help to our families, schools, hospitals, and businesses who have been hit hard by this virus.

1139273933868474368.text: Nebraskan Brent Zoucha is a hero, and it is my honor to tell his story. https://t.co/tTRXsgQeIP

1139273729148686346.text: Brent’s mother remembers him as an ideal son who loved his life and everyone around him. We cannot thank him enough for his service to our country.

1139273728154578946.text: Brent’s death shocked the central Nebraska community, and during his service, the streets were lined with American Flags and Patriot riders.

1139273727139635201.text: On June 9, 2006, Brent and four other Marines came across an IED. Tragically, all of them lost their lives due to the wounds they sustained.

1139273726149758979.text: His mother remembers talking on the phone with him in early June and sending him a care package of fig cookies. She didn’t know it at the time, but that was the last conversation she would have with him. #NEheroes

1139273725151522816.text: This area of Iraq saw the majority of its fighting and counterinsurgency from 2004 until 2007. Brent arrived in the heat of battle. #Service

1139273724140621824.text: Coincidentally, he was assigned to the exact Marine Corp unit as his older brother. Once Brent arrived to Twentynine Palms, he and his brother found out that they were both deploying to the AL An Bar Province in Iraq.

1139273722815287310.text: The extreme discipline that his brother and other Marines routinely displayed greatly interested him. So after graduating from @HPCSTORM he enlisted in the @USMC. #NEheroes

1139273721980620808.text: Like many small-town Nebraska boys, Brent spent a lot of time hunting and fishing. He had a special way with animals and even trained a chicken to fly on his shoulder on command.

1139273720705552395.text: Brent Zoucha grew up in the small town of Clarks, Nebraska. The youngest of four siblings, his mother described him as having a great smile and always goofing around.

1139258016748986368.text:
This afternoon I will continue my tribute to Nebraska’s heroes who paid the ultimate sacrifice for our freedom. Join me as I honor the life of Lance Corporal Brent Zoucha from Clarks, Nebraska. 
Tune in here:  https://t.co/xbTtPbgEDW

1123714262495571968.text: Specialist Blake Kelly embodied the pride of his small town and his state, he served his country with distinction, and he loved his family. I am honored to be able to tell his story. https://t.co/mjSi5VMAG4

1123712606991265793.text: Today, Blake’s son Simon is a freshman in high school. The town of Shelby, NE dedicated a veterans’ memorial to Blake so his spirit can live on.

1123712606013919235.text: His rural Nebraska community and the entire state were shocked. They all turned out for the funeral, as did the freedom riders from throughout Nebraska.

1123712605032460288.text: On July 29, 2003, Black was killed in an accident involving his convoy and a local vehicle. He was the first casualty of a deployed Nebraska Army National Guard Member in over a decade. #Sacrifice

1123712604025819138.text: In Bosnia, Blake was always ready to serve and he connected well with the local population. Unit chaplains needed his help and he became a Eucharistic Minister who actively supported chapel programs.

1123712603044315145.text: Christina and Blake were married on September 7, 2002, just as the National Guard 1-167th Cavalry was preparing to deploy to Bosnia. Right before Blake was deployed the couple found out they were expecting.

1123712602050375680.text: He returned home in September 2001, just as life in the United States was changing forever following the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

1123712601060409344.text: Before graduating from high school, he asked his girlfriend Christina to marry him before going to @FortKnockKY for advanced training that included Ranger training.

1123712600074854401.text: Blake saw joining @NENationalGuard as an opportunity to spread his wings and go to college using the Guard’s tuition assistance program.

1123712598883672067.text: Blake knew everyone around town and everyone knew him. He was always happy and eager to help someone solve a problem. #LoveNE

1123712597860200450.text: .@NENationalGuard Specialist Blake Kelly was born and raised in Shelby, NE. He was a typical small-town Nebraska boy- his early life was filled football, track, and band.

1115663002664042497.text: Today Senator @MarkWarner and I introduced the bipartisan Deceptive Experiences To Online Users Reduction or DETOUR Act 💻 to curb the use of “dark patterns” & increase trust online. Read more here: https://t.co/qD8wLAzJDH

1115663001590345729.text: “Dark Patterns” are manipulative user interfaces that intentionally limit understanding & undermine consumer choice. Misleading prompts to just click the OK button can often transfer your contacts, messages, browsing activity, photos, or location info w/out you even realizing it.

1106271381342380034.text: I am honored to tell Cory’s story and join Nebraskans and Americans across our county in saluting Cory’s willingness to serve.

1106271379442290688.text: Today, if you go to Chadron, Nebraska you will see the Sergeant Cory Mracek Memorial Post Office. I was proud to work w/ former NE Senator Mike Johanns on a bill renaming this post office in honor Cory.

1106271376636346369.text: Communities came together to line the streets as his funeral procession went through their town as it made its 46-mile journey across Nebraska.

1106271374627217409.text: A week later 600 family members, friends, and military officials gathered inside a Nebraska gymnasium to celebrate and honor Cory and his sacrifice for our country.

1106271371762515968.text: Cory and two other U.S. service members were killed by the explosion. #NEhero

1106271368767787008.text: On January 27, 2004, his mother remembers spending the morning instant messaging with Cory to catch up and see how he was doing. Later that same day, Cory and his reconnaissance platoon were performing a mission where they came across an IED.

1106271365894729728.text: After a couple of years in active duty, he was deployed to #Iraq to an area that saw major combat activity and sectarian violence during 2003-2007.

1106271364313436170.text: He came back home in 2001 and transitioned back to the @NENationalGuard. However, when 9/11 happened, Cory told his parents that he was going to go back to the Active Army so he could serve his country. #Service

1106271361100582913.text: A year later, Cory transferred to the Active Army & was soon deployed to South Korea. He enjoyed his time there and he even participated in the #ManchuaMile where he marched for 24-miles in full combat gear.

1106271358252650497.text: After graduating high school, he went on to attend college at @Chadronstate. While in college he decided to join the @NENationalGuard and left to go train at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. #NEhero

1106271356612694017.text: During high school, he became involved in many extracurricular activities and played basketball and football.

1106271353748025345.text: Born in Chadron, Nebraska, Cory Mracek was always trying to have a good time. He was often found either laughing or trying to make others laugh.

1106268171970011136.text: NOW: I’m continuing my tributes to the men and women who have lost their lives defending our freedom. Please join me in honoring Sergeant Cory Mracek of Hay Springs, NE. https://t.co/hdj9qxTRjg

1090734424033918977.text: As the 2009 bipartisan Congressional Commission on the Strategic Posture of the United States stated: ‘Potential aggressors should have to worry about the possibility that the United States might respond by overwhelming means at a time and in a manner of its choosing.

1090734422859620352.text: With Russia and China increasingly attempting to intimidate their neighbors – some of whom are U.S. allies – this is the wrong message to send. It betrays a naïve and disturbed world view.

1090734421437792257.text: Presidents from both parties, including the Obama administration, have rejected a no-first-use policy because it erodes deterrence, undermines allied confidence in U.S. security guarantees and risks emboldening potential adversaries. https://t.co/85V9n67wQY

1090734420422733826.text: Calculated ambiguity has long been an element of U.S. nuclear declaratory policy.

1086018709079158785.text:
Proud to once again chair the @SASCMajority Strategic Forces Subcommittee. As chairman of this critical nat’l security panel, I will continue @US_Stratcom oversight & work to advance modernization of the nation’s nuclear arsenal.
 
My full statement: https://t.co/xPlnEXqfPr https://t.co/qb4syq78oT

1085957431312744449.text: Just in: The administration has released the Missile Defense Review. Check out my full statement: https://t.co/azgfpGsUj4 https://t.co/7BHYuatYSu

1085650610773405700.text: During this Congress, I’m looking forward to working with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle on this key priority and continuing our work in providing for a strong national defense.

1085650609271844864.text: While @US_Stratcom is located in Sarpy County, NE, it is a national asset with a global mission – over 180,000 Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen, Marines, and civilians are working every day around the world in support of the command’s mission. #Service

1085650608260972544.text: That means any delay or any error, could put at risk our ability to field an effective nuclear deterrent in the future, and we cannot allow that to happen. In the face of growing threats, our deterrent must remain strong.

1085650606809726977.text: As a result of decisions to delay and defer funding, there is no margin for error in the schedule.

1085650605215932417.text: The command and control networks that our nuclear forces rely on are also in need of replacement, as is the scientific #infrastructure that maintains our stockpile of aging warheads.

1085650603265511425.text: As our nuclear deterrent becomes more important to our nation’s defense, the need for nuclear modernization only grows. This conclusion is echoed by the administration’s #NuclearPostureReview.

1085650601805897729.text: Meanwhile, our warheads and delivery systems age toward obsolescence, as does the #infrastructure that maintains our deterrent.

1085650599855542272.text: With #Russia and #China increasingly seeking to challenge US interests and reshape the geopolitical landscape in their favor, the unique role our nuclear forces play in deterring conflict & preventing war is becoming increasingly important.

1085650598345662464.text: As part of the effort to ensure our military is prepared for new threats, we must continue modernizing our #nuclearforces.

1085650596743397377.text: I’m entering my 7th year on the Senate Armed Services Committee where we’ve continued the committee’s long-standing, bipartisan tradition of working to strengthen our #military.

1085650594986045440.text: First, I want to recognize the brave Americans who were killed in the suicide attack in #Syria today. Our deepest sympathies are with the families of those killed and the injured. We are so grateful to these Americans for their service and sacrifice.

1068266750142230528.text: Watch my full Senate floor tribute to Corporal Matt Henderson who died in Iraq in May 2004 while serving our country. #NEHeroes https://t.co/5vDtpJx7TP

1068233553375301633.text: I join Nebraskans and Americans across our country in saluting Matt’s bravery and #sacrifice. It is an honor to tell his story. #NEhero

1068233459381010432.text: Matt was a consistent source of inspiration for his fellow Marines, he was the kind of young man that people were just drawn to. He was tough yet a selfless Marine. #SemperFi

1068233320029405189.text: For his ultimate sacrifice, Corporal Matt Henderson received the naval achievement medal with cluster, a Purple Heart, and he was the first to receive the prestigious Non-Commissioned Officer Combat Engineer of the Year award posthumously.

1068233130576920576.text: Matt warned his squad to get back and take cover but was unable to get out of range himself. The remainder of his squad survived. #Leadership #Service #Sacrifice

1068232955959619586.text: As a squad leader, Matt was aware of and concerned about the dangers of his second deployment. On May 26, 2004, Matt was leading his squad in sweeping an area in the Al Anbar province of Iraq. During the sweep, Matt and two of his men were killed when an IED was detonated #NEhero

1068232896379527168.text: In February of 2004, Matt deployed to Iraq for the second time and Jaimie moved back to #Nebraska to be closer to their families.

1068232780658688001.text: Upon Matt’s return home in May of 2003, he and Jaimie finally had their big church wedding in Lincoln, NE. They moved to California where Matt was stationed.

1068232680779784199.text: During his deployment, Matt was chosen to be a squad leader due to his #leadership abilities & the respect of the other Marines. Matt’s family had no communication with him during this time and watched the news every evening with the hopes of catching a glimpse of Matt.

1068232622323785735.text: In February of 2003, Matt deployed to Iraq where he joined other U.S. led forces in the invasion of Iraq from Kuwait in order to oust Saddam Hussein. #NEhero

1068232402215018496.text: On August 4, 2001, Matt proposed to his girlfriend Jaimie on Mission Beach in San Diego just after sunset. As they planned their wedding in Nebraska, Matt’s unit was informed they would be among the first forces to invade Iraq.

1068232327690633216.text: Due to his strong interest in the construction field, Matt also finished Combat Engineer School at Camp Lejeune, and he was assigned to the 1st Combat Engineers Battalion at Camp Pendleton.

1068232236053475330.text: In 2000, Matt joined the @USMC because he was attracted to the discipline & direction it offered. He completed boot camp at @MCRD_SD before attending & completing infantry training at @MCIWPendletonCA. #Service

1068231990774833152.text: Matt loved sports and was a devout @Huskers and @ChicagoBears fan. #GBR #Tradition

1068231854925537280.text: After Matt’s father finished veterinary school, he moved the family to the Good Life. As Matt grew up, he made many friends and could be found by his dad’s side on equine veterinary visits.

1068231679049953282.text: Happening Now: I am speaking on the Senate floor about the life and service of Nebraska’s Corporal Matt Henderson. #NEHeroes #Service

1068226631670644736.text: SOON: I will continue my initiative honoring Nebraska heroes who have given their lives for our country in Iraq & Afghanistan. Watch as I pay tribute to Corporal Matt Henderson of Lincoln, NE on the Senate floor. Live stream: https://t.co/hdj9qxTRjg

1044294213104480256.text: Now that this guidance is out, I encourage employers, especially small businesses, to take advantage of this opportunity to offer #PaidFamilyLeave. The program provides working families more #flexibility as they balance caring for their loved ones with work obligations. https://t.co/7HDICmlTIz

1044294211103850496.text: Our bill would extend the tax credit to give businesses more time to implement a program, expand #PaidFamilyLeave for employees, and allow lawmakers to access sufficient data to assess the effectiveness of the program. Read the bill here ➡️: https://t.co/XY4xauGB8d

1044294209640042498.text: Because the guidance on using the credit was not issued until today @SenAngusKing @SenDeanHeller and I have introduced new legislation: The #PaidFamilyLeavePilotExtensionAct.

1044294207920373761.text: Under current law, the program is a two-year tax credit. This was intended to give Congress the opportunity to determine its effectiveness.

1044294204187443200.text: The policy is targeted to hourly employees who would not otherwise have access to #PaidFamilyLeave. Employees who participate cannot make more than $72,000 per year. https://t.co/bUuuhOuX09

1044294201683431425.text: In exchange for offering #PaidFamilyLeave, employers will receive as much as a 25% tax credit for the amount of wages replaced. #StrongFamiliesAct https://t.co/cJJBXzuEqu

1044294197350723584.text: Through this historic and voluntary program, employers can offer up to 12 weeks of #PaidFamilyLeave. The leave can be used to take care of a family member or utilized for maternity or paternity leave with biological or adopted children. https://t.co/Q8Hq0zup95

1044294194834132992.text: BREAKING: @USTreasury and the @IRSnews just released guidance enabling employers, particularly small businesses, to offer Americans #PaidFamilyLeave through my tax incentive championed in the #TaxCutsandJobsAct. 1004807679070613505.text: On the Senate floor today, I paid tribute to the life & service of @NENationalGuard Sgt. First Class Tricia Jameson of St. Paul, NE. Tricia will always be remembered as a #NEHero. Full video here: https://t.co/4LUKhw3Cxa

1004777686076739585.text: Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson loved her family, she embodied the pride of her state and the values of our nation. #NEHeroes #Service 🇺🇸

1004777566769745921.text: For her service to our nation, Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson earned many military decorations, including the Purple Heart and Bronze Star posthumously. #NEHeroes #Service

1004777516719071233.text: Sgt. Jameson’s name and reputation live on as soldiers save lives, just as she did, on the battlefield.

1004777363656314880.text: Without hesitation, Sgt. Jameson answered the call. She was speeding towards the battlefield to attend to the fallen when her field ambulance was struck by an IED. That day, she gave her life while serving her country.

1004777312091504641.text: Sgt. Jameson and her battle buddy, Specialist Rachelle Spors received an urgent call to help injured Marines in combat a few miles from where they were.

1004777078313582598.text: By June of 2005, Sgt. Jameson was in Iraq on duty with the 313th Medical Company at Camp Speicher. Jameson’s first mission on the road was a long one. She was the vehicle commander of an M997 ambulance that was headed to Trebil near the Jordan border.

1004776990480707584.text: With her determination, she raised that program into a world-class operation. The soldiers who took her program went on to save lives around the world.

1004776877633007616.text: As combat intensified in #Afghanistan and #Iraq, Tricia was tasked with improving the Combat Life Saver course, which teaches soldiers basic medical skills for the battlefield.

1004776812818456581.text: After high school, Tricia joined the @NENationalGuard in 1994. With her grit and determination, she soon was promoted to become a full-time training instructor at Camp Ashland.

1004776371766382594.text: Tricia grew up in the farm country of St. Paul, NE, and at a young age, she advocated for what is right and how others should be treated.

1004776325490577410.text: Each Nebraska hero has a powerful story, and today, I’m honoring the life of @NENationalGuard Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson.

1004775622995005440.text: 🚨 SOON: Watch as I speak on the #SenateFloor to honor a #NebraskaHero Sergeant First Class Tricia Jameson. Live link: https://t.co/iO67fanZp8
